content: I have a number of people from the Backdrop en Español community whiling to learn about use cases for backdrop, so that they can choose it for their next projects. Can you guys share a brief of your successful Backdrop sites and why do you prefer it over D8/D9, Symfony, Wordpress, etc?
Is someone talking about Wordpress again?
@develCuy I think that's the whole purpose of the https://backdropcms.org/showcase page...
Damn @BWPanda ...you just beat me to it :smile: :+1:
@BWPanda Yes, we are looking at that page, but I would like to link projects to people so that perhaps we can grab more feedback
We've got a few nonprofits where we chose to upgrade to Backdrop from d7 because they need something stable, cheaper to upgrade and simple
@Herb Can we then say that Backdrop is sustainable for the low-end market?
I would say that

Hi @develCuy I wrote a longer article two years ago how and why i switched to Backdrop, and what I expect from a CMS, maybe Google Translate (German to Spanish) can help you... https://mazze.ch/backdropcms

Backdrop CMS wird zunehmend zur echten Alternative für die Drupal-Plattform. Ein Erfahrungsbericht.
Backdrop CMS ist ein sogenannter «Fork» von Drupal. Solche Abspaltungen vom «Mutterprojekt» sind ein wichtiger Kern der Opensource-Idee, aber in der Praxis meistens von erheblichen Nebengeräuschen begleitet. Das war vor über fünf Jahren im Drupal-Projekt nicht anders. Eine Gruppe um Jen Lampton und Nate Haug – beides langjährige Drupal-Entwickler – kündigte an, eine frühe Version von Drupal 8 zu «forken» und fortan eigenständig weiterzuentwickeln. Warum es Backdrop CMS überhaupt gibt Was war passiert?

@develCuy Unfortunately, in the showcase there is no info about the people who built the sites. Here are sites mentioned in the showcase built by me, hope that helps: https://backdropcms.org/showcase/fortext, https://backdropcms.org/showcase/olafski, https://backdropcms.org/showcase/awv-09
(Actually, I built more Backdrop sites, all in German language, though. Let me know if a list would be helpful.)
@develCuy yes, I would say that

develCuy said:

Herb Can we then say that Backdrop is sustainable for the low-end market?

@develCuy This post I made several years ago may help you. It goes into detail with all the reasons we switched from Drupal to Backdrop for our mid-level clients. I would add one more reason - the user/developer community is very responsive, far more than Drupal ever was for small agencies, and needed changes get made very quickly (within a few weeks). It makes it a lot more sustainable for us and a much easier transition for our clients who are on Drupal 7 already. The ones we've moved to Wordpress, that are actively updating their sites, don't care for it nearly as much as the ones using Backdrop. It's easier and more intuitive to manage than Wordpress if it's more than just a small blog.
https://www.drupal.org/forum/general/general-discussion/2017-04-27/drupal-8-feedback-from-a-customer-standpoint
Danke!
Silly question, how to add things to showcase?

develCuy said:

Danke!

Bitte!
If you have an account on backdropcms.org, you should be able to add a Showcase node.

Olaf Grabienski said:

If you have an account on backdropcms.org, you should be able to add a Showcase node.

I do and I'll try it this week! (Man, the list is piling up of stuff I need to do for Backdrop!) :-)

@Elisabeth Garbeil

This post I made several years ago may help you. It goes into detail with all the reasons we switched from Drupal to Backdrop for our mid-level clients...

Which post? I'm not seeing a link to anything.

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

Elisabeth Garbeil

This post I made several years ago may help you. It goes into detail with all the reasons we switched from Drupal to Backdrop for our mid-level clients...
